summary: The Etihad Stadium in Manchester, England, is home to Manchester City football club. It's the 7th biggest football stadium in England and can hold over 53,000 fans. Originally built for the 2002 Commonwealth Games, it was later converted into a football stadium. The stadium has hosted many important events, including UEFA Cup final and England's rugby and football matches. Its unique design with a cable-stayed roof has won several awards. In 2015, an extra 7,000 seats were added, and a major expansion is planned for the future.
title: City of Manchester Stadium
